sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 10:26): cristinas: You should use the XWiki codestyle: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/CodeStyle  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 10:29): hi!  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 10:29): ok  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 10:31): I didn't add comments   
cristinas - (08/06/2009 10:31): I will add them soon  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 10:31): K  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 10:33): I wasted some time to create non modal dialogs .. I didn't find in the documentation a solution  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 10:33): I will write more about it in the next post  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 10:35): anyway it works now  
tuska joined #xwiki at 10:35

mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 10:49): Hi   
mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 10:49): What do i have to enter in the  default document syntax when i wish to use XWiki 2.0 ?  
mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 10:50): (In General XWiki preferences)  
vmassol - (08/06/2009 10:51): mondstrahl128: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HConfiguringWikiSyntaxesanddefaultSyntax  
mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 10:52): Thank you  
mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 10:53): Great, it works.

jvelociter - (08/06/2009 13:33): search wiki macro bridge  
jvelociter - (08/06/2009 13:33): how do I search on JIRA ?  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 13:34): jira something  
jvelociter - (08/06/2009 13:34): jira wiki macro  
jvelociter - (08/06/2009 13:35): sdumitriu: thanks  
jvelociter - (08/06/2009 13:35): cool  
jvelociter - (08/06/2009 13:35): jira macro bridge  
jvelociter - (08/06/2009 13:35): I think it's stuck :)  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 13:35): It takes a while  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 13:35): Lots of communications  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 13:35): irc -> xwiki.org -> jira -> xwiki.org -> irc  
jvelociter - (08/06/2009 13:36): yep  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 13:44): hi!  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 13:44): Hi cristinas  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 13:45): I began to implement a class with the ierahical structure of the XWiki (spaces/ pages/ attachments) .. and just to make sure ..there isn't any other class in the XWiki platform which does the same thing, right?   
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 13:46): Not exactly  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 13:46): You can look at xwiki-xmlrpc-model  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 13:47): ok, thanks  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 13:47): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-xmlrpc/xwiki-xmlrpc-model/  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 13:47): Or at XEclipse: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/xeclipse/trunk/plugins/org.xwiki.eclipse.core/src/main/java/org/xwiki/eclipse/core/model/  
cristinas - (08/06/2009 13:47): yes I've found it   
cristinas - (08/06/2009 13:47): thank you

mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 15:32): Is it possible to protect a space with a simple password when accessed ?  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:34): Not easily  
mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 15:34): Aha - but possible ...  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:34): Yes  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:34): It's Open Source, so you can always hack the sources  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:34): You can hack into Java  
mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 15:34): or can i use .htaccess ?  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:34): Or you can do a lightweight check in a template, based on a cookie  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:35): Or use .htaccess if you're using an Apache frontend  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:35): The .htaccess is the easiest  
mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 15:35): ok  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:35): But it doesn't offer a real protection  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:36): A user with write access to another space could programatically include the content of a restricted document, unless the wiki also has access rights  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:36): It depends on who should be left out by the password  
mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 15:36): Oh thats no problem for me  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 15:37): If you have real xwiki users, you can play with the access rights  
mondstrahl128 - (08/06/2009 15:38): Thank you very much.  
alexmaru joined #xwiki at 16:12  
tharindu joined #xwiki at 16:17  
jvelociter left at 16:32 ()  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 16:38): Good day everyone, I've got an upgrade question...    I just updated our .war install from 1.9m1 to 1.9rc1, I'm wondering do people generally also update the .xar file as well?   The documentation suggests you can do so provided you don't import documents that you have modified...  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 16:38): Yes, you should  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 16:39): is there a systematic way to determine what should be omitted from the import?  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 16:40): seems like \*Preferences, \*Groups, and any pages or components modified (Main.WebHome, etc)...   
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 16:40): Everything you modified, plus:  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 16:40): - XWiki.XWikiPreferences  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 16:40): - XWiki.XWikiAllGroup  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 16:40): - XWiki.Admin  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 16:40): - XWiki.AdminGroup  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 16:41): Yes, that is correct  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 16:41): and as far as backup goes, a mysqldump / restore will cover it if I mess up (we are using the mysql hibernate backend)  
sdumitriu - (08/06/2009 16:42): Yes  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 16:42): thanks  
asyd - (08/06/2009 16:47): ah no  
asyd - (08/06/2009 16:47): stop releasing xwiki so fast :)  
asyd - (08/06/2009 16:47): what about a new xwiki watch  
asyd - (08/06/2009 16:47): I'm waiting for it:/  
alexmaru left at 16:58 ("good bye")  
vmassol\_ joined #xwiki at 17:08  
vmassol left at 17:12 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:14): guys I think we have potential bugs in XWiki on currency. For in the rendering in AbstractMacroSource we have:  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:14): protected Map<Syntax, Map<String, Macro< ? >>> syntaxSpecificMacros;  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:14): and the constructor constructs a HashMap  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:14): so if multiple threads try to access it we'll get a concurrent exception AFAIK  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:15): the solution I believe is to use ConcurrentHashMap  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:15): sdumitriu: wdyt?  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:16): (sdumitriu: btw you're not logged on skype)  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:17): tuska: wdyt?  
arunreddy joined #xwiki at 17:18  
tuska - (08/06/2009 17:18): hmm  
tuska - (08/06/2009 17:19): syntaxSpecificMacros is created and loaded just one time at startup right ? when the component is initialized i mean  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:19): I think we need to review all our singleton components and ensure all maps use ConcurrentHashMap  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:19): tuska: there's a potential pb for get too I think  
tuska - (08/06/2009 17:20): so there is onconcurrent read, right ?  
tuska - (08/06/2009 17:20): if there is only read i think it should be ok  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:20): not sure  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:20): it depends on the implementation  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:20): so it depends on the JVM  
tuska - (08/06/2009 17:20): yes but i doubt Map modify anything when we get  
tuska - (08/06/2009 17:21): but yes with ConcurrentHashMap we are sure to not have issues  
tuska - (08/06/2009 17:21): but if it's not needed it would be better for perf to not use the concurrent version  
tuska - (08/06/2009 17:22): (reconecting with the right login)  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:22): tuska: it could set a state internally  
tuska left at 17:22 ("Ex-Chat")  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 17:22  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:22): should be ok now  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:23): vmassol\_: looking if i can find something in the javadoc  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:23): tmortagne: I checked some forums and posts  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:23): and they were saying that it's not guranteed and not clear from the javadoc  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:23): ko  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:23): in any case if we have an add method it could fail  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:23): ok  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:24): then yes if it's not absolutely sure that HashMap does not modify anything when get we should use  ConcurrentHashMap  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:25): http://www.javamex.com/tutorials/synchronization\_concurrency\_8\_hashmap.shtml  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:25): btw whet do plexus do when yuo request a list with a lookup ? does it create a new List each time ?  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:27): tmortagne: I was indeed looking at my impl of EmbeddableCM to see if I was managing the threading correctly before enabling it by default  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:44): tmortagne: just realized that our ParseException doesn't do what it says it does.... there's no filename, line number, etc  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:45): and wiki model doesn't seem to pass this information  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:45):  (in WikiParserException)  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:45): did not know ParseException was suppose to have all this  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:46): this is another argument to add the line/column at parser level  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:47): tmortagne: I don't think we can have filename though since it's a stream as input.... I'll remove that one for now  
lucien left at 17:47 ("Leaving.")  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:47): the filename/wiki page could be stored in the context  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:47): org.wikimodel.wem.xwiki.javacc.ParseException seems to have some information that we could use  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:48): tmortagne: it needs to work in non wiki mode too  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:48): all pure javacc api has the line/colum AFAIK  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:48): we could call it "source name"  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:48): or "source identifier"  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:50): tmortagne: I'l not sure it's useful compared to the pain of implementing it  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:50): the token information is useful OTOH  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:51): (begin/end line/column + token value)  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:52): problem is that if we have a include the line/colum information without the source will be weird for the user  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:53): tmortagne: the user knows the source   
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 17:53): for me it's up to the caller of the rendering to report any source information  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:54): I mixed ParseException returned by the parser and the exception returned by the rendering in XWiki  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:54): yes Perser is not supposed to kno the source identifier  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 17:54): \*Parser  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 17:56): what does "with history" do on an import?  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 17:56): does it preserve the history of the documents being upgraded so one could roll them back individually?  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 18:00): shizzle... space permissions are botched  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 18:00): I'm seeing a loading bar and " xe.grid.loadingxe.grid.loading   Page" when trying to edit the rights on a space  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 18:04): jk\_work: if you've upgraded you may have forgotten to update the XAR or you could try to refresh your cache  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 18:04): (browser cache)  
lucaa1 left at 18:06 ("Leaving.")  
cypromis left at 18:06 ()  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 18:06): vmassol\_: I just did the xar file update now, haven't cleared my browser cache though, I'll try that   
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 18:07): vmassol\_: yeah, it was my browser's cache alright...  that's tricky  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 18:07): thanks!  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 18:07): cool  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 18:11): tmortagne: actually the parser should never generate any exception!  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 18:11): (wikimodel parser)  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 18:11): if it generates an exception it means there's a bug  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 18:12): vmassol\_: true  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 18:17): er...  I have a small patch to offer what's the best way to publish it ? pastebin?  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 18:20): jk\_work: generally the best is to create an issue on http://jira.xwiki.org to explain what the problem/improvement and attach your patch here  
tmortagne - (08/06/2009 18:20): (here=the jira issue)  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 18:20): ok will do  
vmassol\_ - (08/06/2009 18:27): jk\_work: see here http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing  
jk\_work - (08/06/2009 18:30): XWIKI-3955 created :D
